channel.title: CiTR -- Powerchord
channel.description: Vancouver's longest running Metal show on the air. If you're into music that's slightly into the heavier/darker side of the spectrum then you'll like Powerchord. Sonic assault provided by Geoff The Metal Pimp and Andy Grotesque.
channel.itunes:summary: Vancouver's longest running Metal show on the air. If you're into music that's slightly into the heavier/darker side of the spectrum then you'll like Powerchord. Sonic assault provided by Geoff The Metal Pimp and Andy Grotesque.
channel.itunes:author: CiTR 101.9 Vancouver
channel.itunes:subtitle: Vancouver's longest running Metal show on the air.

item.title: Broadcast on 10-Sep-2011
item.description:
Andy grotesques return to the airwaves marks a amazing feat, as he attempts to emulate spinal tap's "3 concerts in one day" (back in 92), by doing Generation Annihilation Powerchord & a brand new show at a mission station this evening!! If thats not Metal ..i don't what is!!!
Today's show Andy spotlighted the mostly unknown Asian Metal scene from China and Taiwan, While Ron provided long awaited brand new tracks from Anthrax, Dream theater and Opeth, as well as other Metallic might! PROUD TO BE LOUD!!!!
item.itunes:subtitle: Another ,sunny, Sat, Metal Ron & Andy G.,decimate the airwaves once again!! (enjoy!)

item.itunes:subtitle: The return of the "GEOFF" the "METAL PIMP" & M.R...bringin the old , new & obscure!!

item.description: Metal Ron breaks his convention of playing the 'now", and gives you a show playing the then. Taking you back to the by -gone era of the 80's & 90's in sets by country , with just a smattering of current and new and have fun with it. This molton playlist from past included such classic bands as, "Holocaust", "Malice", "Living Death", "Jaguar" & more, plus some great new Canadian dities as locals "Ancients" & new "Into Eternity". So dust off those wristbands and BANG THOSE HEADS!!!
item.itunes:subtitle: solo again , but Breaking tradition, M.R. decided to mix it up and do the retro thang ..

item.title: Broadcast on 06-Aug-2011
item.description: On a hot summer day here in July, METAL RON sweated it out in the stuffy studio, (not letting an early technical gremlin detour him), cranking out some classic METAL like "Trouble", "Coroner", "Metal Church", and lots of new treats as new 'Mastodon", "Opeth", "Evile" and not forgetting the CANADIAN onslaught of Mortillery, classic Razor, "Into Eternity: and a whole lot more!!! WHO NEEDS A DEMOLITION CREW WHEN POWERCHORD CAN DO THE JOB WITH A TWIST OF THE VOLUME CONTROL!!! enjoy!
item.itunes:subtitle: metal ron goes solo today, bringing a mish mash of old and new...ITS ALL GOOD!

item.title: Broadcast on 23-Jul-2011
item.description: Cradle to Grave sits in with the Mistress of Metal. Cradle to Grave is a local vancouver Metal band that has come back from the Grave. Cradle was formed in 2004 and made alot of fans and headway in the metal scene, but for no real reason they parted ways. Greg, lead singer of CTG, who is also in local metal band Fallen Decade, is one of the only original members of CTG. But now, it has been long awaited, CTG has reformed with a array of talented local metal musicians who have all made their mark on the local metal scene in Vancouver.
item.itunes:subtitle: Welcoming Back Local Metal Talent Cradle to Grave

item.title: Broadcast on 12-Jul-2008
item.description:
So today's show was a continuation from Generation Annihilation's slot time(12pm-1pm).....The first half of The Ocean's Precambrian album was played then and the second half was played on Powerchord's "regular" hour. No album on Powerchord's history has ever been played in it's entirety. PRECAMBRIAN is the first album to ever to do so...enjoy!!!!!
Also tunes from new Keep Of Kalessin,Testament,and Ost Est Ima can be heard.

Get into THE OCEAN!!!!!!

We also bring you tunes from Tiamat,Cavalera Conspiracy,Meshuggah et al and showcasing newer bands like Norway's Pica Fierce as well as our own Canuck bands like Fuck The facts,A TextBook Tragedy,Conquer By Supremacy and the metal Pimp's fav,Sound Of The Swarm.....Enjoy!!!!

item.description:
Well not so much of a competition but more about the roots and nuances of Metal of different eras...a la Judas Priest,Sepultura,Testament,OverKill,et al and mixing w/ Sound Of The Swarm,Before The Dawn,Fuck The Facts etc...
And the interview yours truly, conducted w/ one of Metal's top notch comedians,Mikael(Opeth's Mastermind),hope you enjoy it!!Another new track off Watershed can be heard as well....
